member_organisations:
The City of London Corporation operates through its Lord Mayor, Aldermen and other members of the Court of Common Council (equivalent to councillors and known as 'Common Councilmen').  
 
There are 100 Common Councilmen and 25 Aldermen (including the Lord Mayor).
fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Economy, finance and the euro, Trade, Taxation, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Single market, Banking and financial services
eu_initiatives: Capital Markets Union, Taxation, Data and cyber issues, Post-trade, EU Reform, Fintech, Better Regulation and Green and Sustainable Finance.
section: VI - Organisations representing local, regional and municipal authorities, other public or mixed entities, etc.
belgium_office_address: City Office in Brussels Rond Point Schuman 6 9th floor
membership:
Confederation of British Industry (CBI) 
TheCityUK 
British Chambers of Commerce in Belgium
relevant_communication:
The City of London's activities include: 
 
Annual Receptions - Brussels and London 
Production of high level position papers  
Research publications linked to seminars 
http://www.cityoflondon.gov.uk/business/economic-research-and-information/Pages/default.aspx 
Occasional media activity
legal_status: Corporation by prescription with local authority functions
goals__remit:
The City of London seeks: 
•    to support and promote London as the world’s leading international financial and business centre and attract new business to the capital and the whole UK 
•    to work in partnership with local communities to increase skills, employment and opportunities for all Londoners, including through the City Bridge Trust 
•    to enhance the capital as a hub of culture, history and green spaces for Londoners – residents, workers, and visitors. 
The City of London works closely with financial services practitioners, trade associations and other stakeholders in order to shape the future direction of financial services policy. It focuses on issues created by EU and international economic, legislative, fiscal and regulatory developments which may impact or threaten to impact on the open, efficient and competitive environment for doing business in the City.
